alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 12 at 3:47AM CDT until August 12 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heat index values 105 to 110 expected. * WHERE...In Arkansas, Crawford, Franklin and Sebastian Counties. In Oklahoma, Washington OK, Nowata, Craig, Creek and Okfuskee Counties. * WHEN...From noon to 8 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a dangerous situation in which heat illnesses are possible.
info.instruction: Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water. To reduce risk during outdoor work the occupational safety and health administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 911.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Washington
